body_content.explanation: to lose the determination to oppose something; to accept defeat:
examples: The town finally succumbed last week after being pounded with heavy artillery for more than two months.
I'm afraid I succumbed to temptation and had a piece of cheesecake.
I felt sure it would only be a matter of time before he succumbed to my charms.

body_content.explanation: to die or suffer badly from an illness:
examples: Thousands of cows have succumbed to the disease in the past few months.
